thread.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers' Denver show has been postponed
thread.title_full: Red Hot Chili Peppers' Denver show has been postponed

author: Dylan Owens
title: Red Hot Chili Peppers' Denver show has been postponed
text:
Print FILE: Red Hot Chili Peppers’ Anthony Kiedis performs at Lollapalooza on Jul. 30, 2016. Photo by Ty Hyten, heyreverb.com. 
The Red Hot Chili Peppers has postponed tonight’s Pepsi Center show until fall, citing lead singer Anthony Kiedis’ falling ill. 
The band has rescheduled its show for October 16, promoter AEG Presents announced in an email. 
“We are so sorry that we cannot come to Denver as planned,” the band wrote in a statement on Thursday morning. “Anthony has been fighting off the bronchitis all week and still needs a few more days to recover. We are sorry for any inconvenience to our fans and look forward to seeing you on October 16th .” 
All previously purchased tickets will be honored at the band’s newly scheduled date. 
The Red Hot Chili Peppers also postponed its San Diego and Glendale, Calif. dates. For more info, check out the band’s website . 
In other Red Hot Chili Pepper news, drummer Chad Smith still looks exactly like Will Ferrell: 695
